description: Coined by Thomas Henry Huxley: binomial translingual Dromæus (“Dromaius”) (from Ancient Greek δρομαῖος (dromaîos, “swift-running”)) + Ancient Greek γνάθος (gnáthos, “jaw”) + English -ous, adjectival suffix

entries.meaning: (ornithology) Possessing a palatal structure akin to the emu and the other (now extinct) species of the genus Dromaius.
examples: The fourth principal type, the dromæognathous, is not found in any Indian birds.
